newsitem.title: USA: U.S. zinc premiums seen steady after Mint tender.
newsitem.headline: U.S. zinc premiums seen steady after Mint tender.

text.p: Five companies were in line for zinc sales to the U.S. Mint following a tender on Wednesday, trade sources said.

Asturmet, Trademet, Future Resources, Hochschild Partners and Phoenixx International Resources were likely to supply a total of 2,224 tonnes of special high grade metal to the Mint at premiums ranging from a low of 4.85 cents per pound, to a high of 6.15 cents, over LME cash.
Some 8,000 tonnes of zinc was offered in the bidding process.
The Mint was due to announce the awards on Thursday.
Although the lower end of the premium scale surprised some, the average of 5.5 cents was in line with spot market levels of 5.25 to 6.00 cents prior to the tender, traders said.
Most zinc is used to galvanize steel.
